intro: Ibetralia surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam starfruit, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the genus Ibetralia within the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes gourds and cucumbers. The plant produces small, yellow, star-shaped fruits that are edible and have a tangy flavor. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its vines climb using tendrils. The plant thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
